0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Japanese encephalitis virus disease; Prophylaxis: (JE-VAX(R)) reserved for use in children 1 through 16 yr old

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• safety and effectiveness in infants under one year of age have not been established
  • Japanese encephalitis virus disease; Prophylaxis: (JE-VAX(R)); over 3 yr old) 1 mL SUBQ x 3 doses on days 0, 7, and 30; booster dose in 2 yr
  • Japanese encephalitis virus disease; Prophylaxis: (JE-VAX(R)); 1 to 3 yr old) 0.5 mL SUBQ on days 0, 7, and 30; booster dose in 2 yr

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• hypersensitivity to Japanese encephalitis virus vaccine product (JE-VAX(R))
  • hypersensitivity to murine-derived products
  • hypersensitivity to thimerosal

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• administer concurrently with other vaccines when possible
  • adverse reactions manifesting as generalized urticaria or angioedema may occur within minutes following vaccination; most reactions occur within 10 days with the majority occurring within 48 hours
  • alcohol intake
  • observe patients for 30 minutes following vaccination; advise patients to remain near access to medical care for 10 days after receiving the vaccine
  • past history of urticaria after hymenoptera envenomation, drugs, physical or other provocations, or of idiopathic cause; greater risk of developing reactions to vaccine
  • pregnancy

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Cardiovascular:Swelling
  • Dermatologic:Erythema, Injection site reaction, Rash
  • Endocrine metabolic:Shivering
  • Gastrointestinal:Abdominal pain, Nausea, Vomiting
  • Musculoskeletal:Myalgia
  • Neurologic:Dizziness, Headache
  • Other:Fever, Malaise, Tenderness
Serious
  • Neurologic:Encephalitis, Encephalopathy, Peripheral neuropathy, Seizure
  • Respiratory:Respiratory distress (rare)
  • Other:Angioedema

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Systemic: Following subcutaneous administration, JE vaccine induces the formation of protective neutralizing antibodies.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    (injection) for SUBQ administration only; do not administer JE-VAX(R) IV or IM
  • Subcutaneous
    reconstitute JE-VAX(R) with supplied diluent (Sterile Water for Injection); shake well

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Advise patients to remain near access to medical care for 10 days after receiving the vaccine, as most adverse reactions occur within the first 10 days of vaccination.
  • Tell patient to wait at least 10 days following completion of immunization schedule before traveling to foreign countries.
  • This drug may cause swelling, erythema, shivering, abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, myalgia, dizziness, headache, fever, malaise, or tenderness.
  • Instruct patient to report signs/symptoms of encephalitis, peripheral neuropathy, seizure, or angioedema (deep swelling around eyes and lips and sometimes hands and feet).
  • Patients should not drink large amounts of alcohol for 2 days following vaccine administration.
